Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 26:220: Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the Knower.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 26:221: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 26:222: They descend on every sinful, false one.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 26:223: They listen eagerly, but most of them are liars.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 26:224: As for poets, the erring follow them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 26:225: Hast thou not seen how they stray in every valley,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 26:226: And how they say that which they do not ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 26:227: Save those who believe and do good works, and remember Allah much, and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:2: These are verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:3: It may be thou frettest thy soul with grief, that they do not become Believers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:4: If (such) were Our Will, We could send down to them from the sky a Sign, to which they would bend their necks in humility.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:5: But there comes not to them a newly-revealed Message from (God) Most Gracious, but they turn away therefrom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:6: They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon (enough) the truth of what they mocked at!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:7: Do they not look at the earth,- how many noble things of all kinds We have produced therein?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:8: Verily, in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:9: And verily, thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:10: Behold, thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:11: "The people of the Pharaoh: will they not fear God?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:12: He said: "O my Lord! I do fear that they will charge me with falsehood:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:14: "And (further), they have a charge of crime against me; and I fear they may slay me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:15: God said: "By no means! proceed then, both of you, with Our Signs; We are with you, and will listen (to your call).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:16: "So go forth, both of you, to Pharaoh, and say: ’We have been sent by the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:17: "’Send thou with us the Children of Israel.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:18: (Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us, and didst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:19: "And thou didst a deed of thine which (thou knowest) thou didst, and thou art an ungrateful (wretch)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:20: Moses said: "I did it then, when I was in error.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:21: "So I fled from you (all) when I feared you; but my Lord has (since) invested me with judgment (and wisdom) and appointed me as one of the apostles.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:22: "And this is the favour with which thou dost reproach me,- that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:23: Pharaoh said: "And what is the ’Lord and Cherisher of the worlds’?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:24: (Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- if ye want to be quite sure.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:25: (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Did ye not listen (to what he says)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:26: (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the beginning!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:27: (Pharaoh) said: "Truly your apostle who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:28: (Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! if ye only had sense!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:29: (Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me, I will certainly put thee in prison!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:30: (Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and) convincing?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:31: (Pharaoh) said: "Show it then, if thou tellest the truth!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:32: So (Moses) threw his rod, and behold, it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:33: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:34: (Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a sorcerer well-versed:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:35: "His plan is to get you out of your land by his sorcery; then what is it ye counsel?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:36: They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while), and dispatch to the Cities heralds to collect-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:37: "And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:38: So the sorcerers were got together for the appointment of a day well-known,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:39: And the people were told: "Are ye (now) assembled?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:40: "That we may follow the sorcerers (in religion) if they win?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:41: So when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Pharaoh: "Of course - shall we have a (suitable) reward if we win?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:42: He said: "Yea, (and more),- for ye shall in that case be (raised to posts) nearest (to my person).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:43: Moses said to them: "Throw ye - that which ye are about to throw!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:44: So they threw their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the might of Pharaoh, it is we who will certainly win!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:45: Then Moses threw his rod, when, behold, it straightway swallows up all the falsehoods which they fake!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:46: Then did the sorcerers fall down, prostrate in adoration,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:47: Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:49: Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? surely he is your leader, who has taught you sorcery! but soon shall ye know!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:50: "Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:51: They said: "No matter! for us, we shall but return to our Lord!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:52: "Only, our desire is that our Lord will forgive us our faults, that we may become foremost among the believers!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:53: By inspiration we told Moses: "Travel by night with my servants; for surely ye shall be pursued.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:54: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to (all) the Cities,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:56: "And they are raging furiously against us;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:57: "But we are a multitude amply fore-warned.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:58: So We expelled them from gardens, springs,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:59: Treasures, and every kind of honourable position;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:60: Thus it was, but We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:61: So they pursued them at sunrise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:62: And when the two bodies saw each other, the people of Moses said: "We are sure to be overtaken.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:63: (Moses) said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:64: Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:65: And We made the other party approach thither.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:66: We delivered Moses and all who were with him;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:68: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:69: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:70: And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham’s story.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:71: Behold, he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:72: They said: "We worship idols, and we remain constantly in attendance on them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:73: He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them), or do you good or harm?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:74: They said: "Nay, but we found our fathers doing thus (what we do).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:75: He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:77: "For they are enemies to me; not so the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:78: "Who created me, and it is He Who guides me;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:80: "And when I am ill, it is He Who cures me;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:81: "Who will cause me to die, and then to life (again);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:82: "And who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the day of Judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:83: "O my Lord! bestow wisdom on me, and join me with the righteous;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:84: "Grant me honourable mention on the tongue of truth among the latest (generations);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:85: "Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:86: "Forgive my father, for that he is among those astray;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:87: "And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be raised up;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:88: "The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:89: "But only he (will prosper) that brings to God a sound heart;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:90: "To the righteous, the Garden will be brought near,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:91: "And to those straying in Evil, the Fire will be placed in full view;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:92: "And it shall be said to them: ’Where are the (gods) ye worshipped-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:93: "’Besides God? Can they help you or help themselves?’
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:94: "Then they will be thrown headlong into the (Fire),- they and those straying in Evil,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:95: "And the whole hosts of Iblis together.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:96: "They will say there in their mutual bickerings:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:97: "’By God, we were truly in an error manifest,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:98: "’When we held you as equals with the Lord of the Worlds;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:99: "’And our seducers were only those who were steeped in guilt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:100: "’Now, then, we have none to intercede (for us),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:101: "’Nor a single friend to feel (for us).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:102: "’Now if we only had a chance of return we shall truly be of those who believe!’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:103: Verily in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:104: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:105: The people of Noah rejected the apostles.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:106: Behold, their brother Noah said to them: "Will ye not fear (God)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:107: "I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:109: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:111: They said: "Shall we believe in thee when it is the meanest that follow thee?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:112: He said: "And what do I know as to what they do?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:113: "Their account is only with my Lord, if ye could (but) understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:114: "I am not one to drive away those who believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:115: "I am sent only to warn plainly in public.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:116: They said: "If thou desist not, O Noah! thou shalt be stoned (to death).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:117: He said: "O my Lord! truly my people have rejected me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:118: "Judge Thou, then, between me and them openly, and deliver me and those of the Believers who are with me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:119: So We delivered him and those with him, in the Ark filled (with all creatures).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:120: Thereafter We drowned those who remained behind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:121: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:122: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:124: Behold, their brother Hud said to them: "Will ye not fear (God)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:125: "I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:127: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:128: "Do ye build a landmark on every high place to amuse yourselves?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:129: "And do ye get for yourselves fine buildings in the hope of living therein (for ever)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:130: "And when ye exert your strong hand, do ye do it like men of absolute power?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:132: "Yea, fear Him Who has bestowed on you freely all that ye know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:133: "Freely has He bestowed on you cattle and sons,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:135: "Truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Great Day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:136: They said: "It is the same to us whether thou admonish us or be not among (our) admonishers!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:137: "This is no other than a customary device of the ancients,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:138: "And we are not the ones to receive Pains and Penalties!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:139: So they rejected him, and We destroyed them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:140: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:142: Behold, their brother Salih said to them: "Will you not fear (God)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:143: "I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:145: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:146: "Will ye be left secure, in (the enjoyment of) all that ye have here?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:148: "And corn-fields and date-palms with spathes near breaking (with the weight of fruit)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:149: "And ye carve houses out of (rocky) mountains with great skill.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:151: "And follow not the bidding of those who are extravagant,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:152: "Who make mischief in the land, and mend not (their ways).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:153: They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:154: "Thou art no more than a mortal like us: then bring us a Sign, if thou tellest the truth!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:155: He said: "Here is a she-camel: she has a right of watering, and ye have a right of watering, (severally) on a day appointed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:156: "Touch her not with harm, lest the Penalty of a Great Day seize you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:157: But they ham-strung her: then did they become full of regrets.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:159: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:160: The people of Lut rejected the apostles.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:161: Behold, their brother Lut said to them: "Will ye not fear (God)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:162: "I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:164: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the lord of the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:165: "Of all the creatures in the world, will ye approach males,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:166: "And leave those whom God has created for you to be your mates? Nay, ye are a people transgressing (all limits)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:167: They said: "If thou desist not, O Lut! thou wilt assuredly be cast out
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:168: He said: "I do detest your doings.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:169: "O my Lord! deliver me and my family from such things as they do!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:170: So We delivered him and his family,- all
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:171: Except an old woman who lingered behind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:172: But the rest We destroyed utterly.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:173: We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was the shower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:174: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:175: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:176: The Companions of the Wood rejected the apostles.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:178: Behold, Shu’aib said to them: "Will ye not fear (God)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:179: "I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:181: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:182: "Give just measure, and cause no loss (to others by fraud).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:183: "And weigh with scales true and upright.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:184: "And withhold not things justly due to men, nor do evil in the land, working mischief.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:185: "And fear Him Who created you and (who created) the generations before (you)"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:186: They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:187: "Thou art no more than a mortal like us, and indeed we think thou art a liar!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:188: "Now cause a piece of the sky to fall on us, if thou art truthful!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:189: He said: "My Lord knows best what ye do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:191: Verily in that is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:192: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:193: Verily this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:194: With it came down the spirit of Faith and Truth-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:195: To thy heart and mind, that thou mayest admonish.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:197: Without doubt it is (announced) in the mystic Books of former peoples.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:199: Is it not a Sign to them that the Learned of the Children of Israel knew it (as true)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:200: Had We revealed it to any of the non-Arabs,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:201: And had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:202: Thus have We caused it to enter the hearts of the sinners.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:203: They will not believe in it until they see the grievous Penalty;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:204: But the (Penalty) will come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:205: Then they will say: "Shall we be respited?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:206: Do they then ask for Our Penalty to be hastened on?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:207: Seest thou? If We do let them enjoy (this life) for a few years,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:208: Yet there comes to them at length the (Punishment) which they were promised!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:209: It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:210: Never did We destroy a population, but had its warners -
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:211: By way of reminder; and We never are unjust.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:212: No evil ones have brought down this (Revelation):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:213: It would neither suit them nor would they be able (to produce it).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:214: Indeed they have been removed far from even (a chance of) hearing it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:215: So call not on any other god with God, or thou wilt be among those under the Penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:217: And lower thy wing to the Believers who follow thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:218: Then if they disobey thee, say: "I am free (of responsibility) for what ye do!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:219: And put thy trust on the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:220: Who seeth thee standing forth (in prayer),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:221: And thy movements among those who prostrate themselves,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:222: For it is He Who heareth and knoweth all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:223: Shall I inform you, (O people!), on whom it is that the evil ones descend?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:224: They descend on every lying, wicked person,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:225: (Into whose ears) they pour hearsay vanities, and most of them are liars.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:226: And the Poets,- It is those straying in Evil, who follow them:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:227: Seest thou not that they wander distracted in every valley?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:228: And that they say what they practise not?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 26:229: Except those who believe, work righteousness, engage much in the remembrance of God, and defend themselves only after they are unjustly attacked.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:2: Those are the signs of the Manifest Book.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:3: Perchance thou consumest thyself that they are not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:4: If We will, We shall send down on them out of heaven a sign, so their necks will stay humbled to it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:5: But never fresh remembrance comes to them from the All-merciful, except they turn away from it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:6: So they have cried lies; therefore assuredly tidings will come to them of that they mocked at.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:7: What, have they not regarded the earth, how many therein We have caused to grow of every generous kind?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:8: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:9: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:10: And when thy Lord called to Moses, ’Go to the people of the evildoers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:11: the people of Pharaoh; will they not be godfearing?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:12: He said, ’My Lord, I fear they will cry me lies,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:13: and my breast will be straitened, and my tongue will not be loosed; so send to Aaron.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:14: They also have a sin against me, and I fear they will slay me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:15: Said He, ’No indeed; but go, both of you, with Our signs, and We assuredly shall be with you, listening.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:16: So go you to Pharaoh, and say, "Verily, I am the Messenger of the Lord of all Being;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:17: so send forth with us the Children of Israel.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:18: He said, ’Did we not raise thee amongst us as a child? Didst thou not tarry among us years of thy life?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:19: And thou didst the deed thou didst, being one of the ungrateful!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:20: Said he, ’Indeed I did it then, being one of those that stray;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:21: so I fled from you, fearing you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:22: That is a blessing thou reproachest me with, having enslaved the Children of Israel.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:23: Pharaoh said, ’And what is the Lord of all Being?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:24: He said, ’The Lord of the heavens and earth, and what between them is, if you have faith.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:25: Said he to those about him, ’Do you not hear?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:26: He said, ’Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers, the ancients.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:27: Said he, ’Surely your Messenger who was sent to you is possessed!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:28: He said, ’The Lord of the East and West, and what between them is, if you have understanding,’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:29: Said he, ’If thou takest a god other than me, I shall surely make thee one of the imprisoned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:30: He said, ’What, even though I brought thee something so manifest?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:31: Said he, ’Bring it then, if thou art of the truthful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:32: So he cast his staff, and behold, it was a serpent manifest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:33: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it was white to the beholders.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:34: Said he to the Council about him, ’Surely this man is a cunning sorcerer
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:35: who desires to expel you from your land by his sorcery; what do you command?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:36: They said, ’Put him and his brother off a while, and send among the cities musterers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:37: to bring thee every cunning sorcerer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:38: So the sorcerers were assembled for the appointed time of a fixed day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:39: The people were asked, ’Will you assemble?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:40: Haply we shall follow the sorcerers if it should be they are the victors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:41: Then, when the sorcerers came, they said to Pharaoh, ’Shall we indeed have a wage, if we should be the victors?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:42: He said, ’Yes indeed; and you shall then be among the near-stationed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:43: Moses said to them, ’Cast you down what you will cast.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:44: So they cast their ropes and their staffs, and said, ’By the might of Pharaoh we shall be the victors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:45: Then Moses cast his staff and lo, it forthwith swallowed up their lying invention;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:46: so the sorcerers were cast down, bowing themselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:47: They said, ’We believe in the Lord of all Being,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:48: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:49: Said Pharaoh, ’You have believed him before I gave you leave.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:50: They said, ’There is no harm; surely unto our Lord we are turning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:51: We are eager that our Lord should forgive us our offences, for that we are the first of the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:52: Also We revealed unto Moses, ’Go with My servants by night; surely you will be followed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:53: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities musterers:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:55: and indeed they are enraging us;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:56: and we are a host on our guard.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:57: So We expelled them from gardens and fountains,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:58: and treasures and a noble station;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:59: even so, and We bequeathed them upon the Children of Israel.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:60: Then they followed them at the sunrise;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:61: and, when the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, ’We are overtaken!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:62: Said he, ’No indeed; surely my Lord is with me; He will guide me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:63: Then We revealed to Moses, ’Strike with thy staff the sea’; and it clave, and each part was as a mighty mount.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:64: And there We brought the others on,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:65: and We delivered Moses and those with him all together;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:67: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:68: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:69: And recite to them the tiding of Abraham
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:70: when he said to his father and his people, ’What do you serve?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:71: They said, ’We serve idols, and continue cleaving to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:72: He said, ’Do they hear you when you call,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:73: or do they profit you, or harm?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:74: They said, ’Nay, but we found our fathers so doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:75: He said, ’And have you considered what you have been serving,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:76: you and your fathers, the elders?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:77: They are an enemy to me, except the Lord of all Being
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:78: who created me, and Himself guides me,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:79: and Himself gives me to eat and drink,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:80: and, whenever I am sick, heals me,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:81: who makes me to die, then gives me life,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:82: and who I am eager shall forgive me my offence on the Day of Doom.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:83: My Lord, give me Judgment, and join me with the righteous,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:84: and appoint me a tongue of truthfulness among the others.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:85: Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:86: and forgive my father, for he is one of those astray.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:87: Degrade me not upon the day when they are raised up,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:88: the day when neither wealth nor sons shall profit
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:89: except for him who comes to God with a pure heart.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:90: And Paradise shall be brought forward for the godfearing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:91: and Hell advanced for the perverse.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:92: It shall be said to them, ’Where is that you were serving
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:93: apart from God? Do they help you or help themselves?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:94: Then they shall be pitched into it, they and the perverse
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:95: and the hosts of Iblis, all together.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:96: They shall say, as they dispute there one with another,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:97: ’By God, we were certainly in manifest error
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:98: when we made you equal with the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:99: It was naught but the sinners that led us astray;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:100: so now we have no intercessors,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:102: O that we might return again, and be among the believers!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:103: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:104: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:105: The people of Noah cried lies to the Envoys
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:106: when their brother Noah said to them, ’Will you not be godfearing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:107: I am for you a faithful Messenger,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:108: so serve you God, and obey you me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:109: I ask of you no wage for this; my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:110: so fear you God, and obey you me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:111: They said, ’Shall we believe thee, whom the vilest follow?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:112: He said, ’What knowledge have I of that they have been doing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:113: Their account falls only upon my Lord, were you but aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:114: I would not drive away the believers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:115: ’I am naught but a plain warner.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:116: They said, ’If thou givest not over, Noah, thou shalt assuredly be one of the stoned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:117: He said, ’My Lord, my people have cried me lies,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:118: so give true deliverance between me and them, and deliver me and the believers that are with me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:119: So We delivered him, and those with him, in the laden ship,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:120: then afterwards We drowned the rest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:121: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:122: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:123: Ad cried lies to the Envoys
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:124: when their brother Hood said to them, ’Will you not be godfearing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:125: I am for you a faithful Messenger,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:126: so fear you God, and obey you me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:127: I ask of you no wage for this; my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:128: What, do you build on every prominence a sign, sporting,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:129: and do you take to you castles, haply to dwell forever?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:130: When you assault, you assault like tyrants!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:131: So fear you God, and obey you me;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:132: and fear Him who has succoured you with what you know,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:133: succoured you with flocks and sons,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:135: ’Indeed, I fear for you the chastisement of a dreadful day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:136: They said, ’Alike it is to us, whether thou admonishest, or art not one of the admonishers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:137: this is nothing but the habit of the ancients,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:138: and we shall not be chastised.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:139: So they cried him lies; then We destroyed them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:140: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:141: Thamood cried lies to the Envoys
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:142: when their brother Salih said to them, ’Will you not be godfearing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:143: am for you a faithful Messenger,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:144: so fear you God, and obey you me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:145: ’I ask of you no wage for this; my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:146: Will you be left secure in this here,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:148: sown fields, and palms with slender spathes?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:149: Will you still skilfully hew houses out of the mountains?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:150: So fear you God, and obey you me;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:151: and obey not the commandment of the prodigal
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:152: who do corruption in the earth, and set not things aright.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:153: They said, ’Thou art merely one of those that are bewitched;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:154: thou art naught but a mortal, like us; then produce a sign, if thou art one of the truthful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:155: He said, ’This is a she-camel; to her a draught and to you a draught, on a day appointed,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:156: and do not touch her with malice so that there seize you the chastisement of a dreadful day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:157: But they hamstrung her, and in the morning they were remorseful,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:159: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:160: The people of Lot cried lies to the Envoys
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:161: when their brother Lot said to them, ’Will you not be godfearing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:162: am for you a faithful Messenger,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:163: so fear you God, and obey you me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:164: I ask of you no wage for this; my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:165: What, do you come to male beings,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:166: leaving your wives that your Lord created for you? Nay, but you are a people of transgressors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:167: They said, ’If thou givest not over, Lot, thou shalt assuredly be one of the expelled.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:168: He said, ’Truly I am a detester of what you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:169: My Lord, deliver me and my people from that they do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:170: My Lord, deliver me and my people from that they do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:171: save an old woman among those that tarried;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:173: and We rained on them a rain; and evil is the rain of them that are warned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:174: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:175: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:176: The men of the Thicket cried lies to the Envoys
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:177: when Shuaib said to them, ’Will you not be godfearing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:178: I am for you a faithful Messenger, so fear you God, and obey you me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:179: I ask of you no wage for this;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:180: my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:181: Fill up the measure, and be not cheaters,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:182: and weigh with the straight balance,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:183: and diminish not the goods of the people, and do not mischief in the earth, working corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:184: Fear Him who created you, and the generations of the ancients.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:185: They said, ’Thou art merely one of those that are bewitched;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:186: thou art naught but a mortal, like us; indeed, we think that thou art one of the liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:187: Then drop down on us lumps from heaven, if thou art one of the truthful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:188: He said, ’My Lord knows very well what you are doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:189: But they cried him lies; then there seized them the chastisement of the Day of Shadow; assuredly it was the chastisement of a dreadful day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:190: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:191: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:192: Truly it is the revelation of the Lord of all Being,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:193: brought down by the Faithful Spirit
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:194: upon thy heart, that thou mayest be one of the warners,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:196: Truly it is in the Scriptures of the ancients.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:197: Was it not a sign for them, that it is known to the learned of the Children of Israel?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:198: If We had sent it down on a barbarian
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:199: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:200: Even so We have caused it to enter into the hearts of the sinners,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:201: who will not believe in it, until they see the painful chastisement
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:202: so that it will come upon them suddenly, while they are not aware,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:203: and they will say, ’Shall we be respited?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:204: What, do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:205: What thinkest thou? If We give them enjoyment of days for many years,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:206: then there comes on them that they were promised,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:207: what will it then avail them, the enjoyment of days they were given?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:208: Never a city We destroyed, but it had warners
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:209: for a reminder; and never did We wrong.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:210: Not by the Satans has it been brought down;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:211: it behoves them not, neither are they able.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:212: Truly, they are expelled from hearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:213: So call thou not upon another god with God, lest thou shouldst be one of those that are chastised.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:214: And warn thy clan, thy nearest kin.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:215: Lower thy wing to those who follow thee, being believers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:216: then, if they disobey thee, say, ’I am quit of that you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:217: Put thy trust in the All-mighty, the All-compassionate
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:218: who sees thee when thou standest
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:219: and when thou turnest about among those who bow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:220: Surely He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:221: Shall I tell you on whom the Satans come down?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:222: They come down on every guilty impostor.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:223: They give ear, but most of them are liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:224: And the poets -- the perverse follow them;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:225: hast thou not seen how they wander in every valley
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:226: and how they say that which they do not?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 26:227: Save those that believe, and do righteous deeds, and remember God oft, and help themselves after being wronged; and those who do wrong shall surely know by what overturning they will he overturned.

Muhammad Asad.verse 26:2: THESE ARE MESSAGES of the divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:3: Wouldst thou, perhaps, torment thyself to death [with grief] because they [who live around thee] refuse to believe [in it]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:4: Had We so willed, We could have sent down unto them a message from the skies, so that their necks would [be forced to] bow down before it in humility.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:5: [But We have not willed it:] and so, whenever there comes unto them any fresh reminder from the Most Gracious, they [who are blind of heart] always turn their backs upon it:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:6: thus, indeed, have they given the lie [to this message as well].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:7: Have they, then, never considered the earth – how much of every noble kind [of life] We have caused to grow thereon?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:8: In this, behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:9: But, verily, thy Sustainer – He alone – is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:10: HENCE, [remember how it was] when thy Sustainer summoned Moses: "Go unto those evildoing people,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:11: the people of Pharaoh, who refuse to be conscious of Me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:12: He answered: "O my Sustainer! Behold, I fear that they will give me the lie,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:13: and then my breast will be straitened and my tongue will not be free: send, then, [this Thy command] to Aaron.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:14: Moreover, they keep a grave charge
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:15: against me, and I fear that they will slay me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:16: Said He: "Not so, indeed! Go forth, then, both of you, with Our messages: verily, We shall be with you, listening [to your call]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:17: And go, both of you, unto Pharaoh and say, ‘Behold, we bear a message from the Sustainer of all the worlds:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:18: Let the children of Israel go with us!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:19: [But when Moses had delivered his message, Pharaoh] said: "Did we not bring thee up among us when thou wert a child? And didst thou not spend among us years of thy
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:21: And yet thou didst commit that
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:22: deed of thine, and [hast thus shown that] thou art one of the ingrate!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:24: "I committed it while I was still going astray;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:25: and I fled from you because I feared you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:26: then my Sustainer has endowed me with the ability to judge [between right and wrong], and has made me one of
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:28: And [as for] that favour of which thou so tauntingly remindest me – [was it not] due to thy having enslaved the children of Israel?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:29: Said Pharaoh: "And what [and who] is that ‘Sustainer of all the worlds’?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:31: answered: "[He is] the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them: if you would but [allow yourselves to] be convinced!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:33: unto those around him: "Did you hear [what he said]?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:35: as well as the Sustainer of your forefathers of old!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:38: your ‘apostle’ who [claims that he] has been sent unto you is mad indeed!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:39: [But Moses] went on: "[He of whom I speak is] the Sustainer of the east and the west and of all that is between the two – [as you would know] if you would but use your reason!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:41: "Indeed, if thou choose to worship any deity other than me, I shall most certainly throw thee into prison!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:42: Said he: "Even if I should bring about before thee something that clearly shows the truth?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:44: answered: "Produce it, then, if thou art a man of truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:46: threw down his staff – and lo! it was a serpent, plainly visible;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:47: and he drew forth his hand – and lo! it appeared
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:50: unto the great ones around him: "Verily, this is indeed a sorcerer of great knowledge
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:51: who wants to drive you out of your land by his sorcery.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:52: They answered: "Let him and his brother wait a while, and send unto all cities heralds
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:53: who shall assemble before thee all sorcerers of great knowledge.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:54: And so the sorcerers were assembled at a set time on a certain day,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:55: and the people were asked: "Are you all present,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:56: so that we might follow [in the footsteps of] the sorcerers if it is they who prevail?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:57: Now when the sorcerers came, they said unto Pharaoh: "Verily, we ought to have a great reward if it is we who prevail.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:58: Answered he: "Yea – and, verily, in that case you shall be among those who are near unto me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:60: Moses said unto them: "Throw whatever you are going to throw!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:62: ropes and their staffs, and said: "By Pharaoh’s might, behold, it is we indeed who have prevailed!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:64: then Moses threw his staff – and lo! it swallowed up all their deceptions.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:65: And down fell the sorcerers, prostrating themselves in adoration,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:67: exclaimed: "We have come to believe in the Sustainer of all the worlds,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:68: the Sustainer of Moses and Aaron!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:70: "Have you come to believe in him ere I have given you permission? Verily, he must be your master who has taught you magic! But in time you shall come to know [my revenge]: most certainly shall I cut off your hands and your feet in great numbers, because of
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:71: perverseness, and shall most certainly crucify you in great numbers, all together!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:72: They answered: "No harm [canst thou do to us]: verily, unto our Sustainer do we turn!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:74: ardently desire that our Sustainer forgive us our faults in return for our having been foremost among the believers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:75: AND [there came a time when] We inspired Moses thus: "Go forth with My servants by night: for, behold, you will be pursued!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:76: And Pharaoh sent heralds unto all cities,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:77: [bidding them to call out his troops and to proclaim:] "Behold, these [children of Israel] are but a contemptible band;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:78: but they are indeed filled with hatred of us
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:79: seeing that we are, verily, a nation united, fully prepared against danger
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:83: and [deprived them of their erstwhile] treasures and station of honour!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:84: Thus it was: but [in the course of time] We were to bestow all these
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:85: as a heritage on the children of Israel.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:86: And so [the Egyptians] caught up with them at sunrise;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:87: and as soon as the two hosts came in sight of one another, the followers of Moses exclaimed: "Behold, we shall certainly be overtaken [and defeated]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:88: He replied: "Nay indeed! My Sustainer is with me,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:90: Thereupon We inspired Moses thus: "Strike the sea with thy staff!" – whereupon it parted, and each part appeared like a mountain vast.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:91: And We caused the pursuers to draw near unto that place:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:92: and We saved Moses and all who were with him,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:93: and then We caused the others to drown.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:95: behold, there is a message [unto all men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:96: And yet, verily, thy Sustainer – He alone – is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:97: AND CONVEY unto them the story of Abraham
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:98: [how it was] when he asked his father and his people, "What is it that you worship?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:99: They answered: "We worship idols, and we remain ever devoted to them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:100: Said he: "Do [you really think that] they hear you when you invoke them,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:101: or benefit you or do you harm?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:102: They exclaimed: "But we found our forefathers doing the same!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:104: "Have you, then, ever considered what it is that you have been worshipping –
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:105: you and those ancient forebears of yours?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:106: "Now [as for me, I know that,] verily, these [false deities] are my enemies, [and that none is my helper] save the Sustainer of all the worlds,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:107: who has created me and is the One who guides me,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:108: and is the One who gives me to eat and to drink,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:109: and when I fall ill, is the One who restores me to health,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:110: and who will cause me to die and then will bring me back to life
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:111: and who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on Judgment Day!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:112: "O my Sustainer! Endow me with the ability to judge [between right and wrong], and make me one with the righteous,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:113: and grant me the power to convey the truth unto those who will come after me,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:114: and place me among those who shall inherit the garden of bliss!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:115: "And forgive my father – for, verily, he is among those who have gone astray
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:116: and do not put me to shame on the Day when all shall be raised from the dead:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:117: the Day on which neither wealth will be of any use, nor children,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:118: [and when] only he [will be happy] who comes before God with a heart free of evil!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:119: For, [on that Day,] paradise will be brought within sight of the God-conscious,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:120: whereas the blazing fire will be laid open before those who had been lost in grievous error;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:121: and they will be asked: "Where now is all that you were wont to worship
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:122: instead of God? Can these [things and beings] be of any help to you or to themselves?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:123: Thereupon they will be hurled into hell – they, as well as all
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:124: who had been lost in grievous error,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:125: and the hosts of Iblīs – all together.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:126: And there and then, blaming one another, they [who had grievously sinned in life] will exclaim:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:127: "By God, we were most obviously astray
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:128: when we deemed you [false deities] equal to the Sustainer of all the worlds
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:129: yet they who have seduced us [into believing in you] are the truly guilty ones!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:130: And now we have none to intercede for us,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:132: Would that we had a second chance [in life], so that we could be among the believers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:133: In all this, behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:134: But, verily, thy Sustainer – He alone – is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:136: gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:137: when their brother Noah said unto them: "Will you not be conscious of God?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:138: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:139: be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:140: "And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:142: They answered: "Shall we place our faith in thee, even though
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:143: the most abject [of people] follow thee?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:144: Said he: "And what knowledge could I have as to what they were doing [before they came to me]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:145: Their reckoning rests with none but my Sustainer: if you could but understand !
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:146: Hence, I shall not drive away [any of] those [who profess to be] believers;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:147: I am nothing but a plain warner.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:148: Said they: "Indeed, if thou desist not, O Noah, thou wilt surely be stoned to death!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:150: he prayed: "O my Sustainer! Behold, my people have given me the lie:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:151: hence, lay Thou wide open the truth between me and them, and save me and those of the believers who are with me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:152: And so We saved him and those [who were] with him in the fully-laden ark,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:153: and then We caused those who stayed behind to drown.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:155: behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:156: But, verily, thy Sustainer – He alone – is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:157: [AND the tribe of] ’ād gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:158: when their brother Hūd said unto them: "Will you not be conscious of God?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:159: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:160: be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:161: "And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:162: "Will you, in your wanton folly, build
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:164: and make for yourselves mighty castles,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:167: whenever you lay hand [on others], lay hand [on them] cruelly, without any restraint?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:168: "Be, then, conscious of God and pay heed unto me:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:170: be conscious of Him who has
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:171: amply provided you with all [the good] that you might think of
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:172: amply provided you with flocks, and children,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:174: for, verily, I fear lest suffering befall you on an awesome day!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:176: they answered: "It is all one to us whether thou preachest [something new] or art not of those who [like to] preach.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:177: This [religion of ours] is none other than that to which our forebears clung,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:178: and we are not going to be chastised [for adhering to it]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:179: And so they gave him the lie: and thereupon We destroyed them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:180: behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:181: But, verily, thy Sustainer – He alone – is almighty.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:182: [AND the tribe of] Thamūd gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:183: when their brother Sālih said unto them: "Will you not be conscious of God?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:184: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:185: be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:186: "And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:187: "Do you think that you will be left secure
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:188: in the midst of what you have here and now?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:193: and that you will [always be able to] hew dwellings out of the mountains with [the same] great skill?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:194: "Be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:195: and pay no heed to the counsel of those who are given to excesses
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:196: those who spread corruption on earth instead of setting things to rights!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:197: Said they: "Thou art but one of the bewitched!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:198: Thou art nothing but a mortal like ourselves! Come, then, forward with a token [of thy mission] if thou art a man of truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:199: Replied he: "This she-camel shall have a share of water, and you shall have a share of water, on the days appointed ;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:200: and do her no harm, lest suffering befall you on an awesome day!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:201: But they cruelly slaughtered her – and then they had cause to regret it:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:202: for the suffering [predicted by Sālih] befell them [then and there].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:203: behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:204: But, verily, thy Sustainer – He alone -is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:206: the people of Lot gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:207: when their brother Lot said unto them: "Will you not be conscious of God?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:208: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:209: be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:210: "And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:213: keeping yourselves aloof from all the
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:214: spouses whom your Sustainer has created for you? Nay, but you are people who transgress all bounds of what is right!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:215: Said they: "Indeed, if thou desist not, O Lot, thou wilt most certainly be expelled [from this township]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:217: exclaimed: "Behold, I am one of those who utterly abhor your doings!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:218: [And then he prayed:] "O my Sustainer! Save me and my household from all that they are doing!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:219: Thereupon We saved him and all his household
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:220: all but an old woman, who was among those that stayed behind;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:221: and then We utterly destroyed the others,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:222: and rained down upon them a rain [of destruction]: and dire is such rain upon all who let themselves be warned [to no avail]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:224: behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:225: But, verily, thy Sustainer – He alone – is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:227: the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan] gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:228: when their brother Shu’ayb said unto them: "Will you not be conscious of God?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:229: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:230: be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:231: "And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:233: give full measure, and be not among those who
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:235: and [in all your dealings] weigh with a true balance,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:236: and do not deprive people of what is rightfully theirs; and do not act wickedly on earth by spreading corruption,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:237: but be conscious of Him who has created you, just as [He created] those countless generations of old!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:238: Said they: "Thou art but one of the bewitched,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:239: for thou art nothing but a mortal like ourselves! And.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:240: Cause, then, fragments of the sky to fall down upon us, if thou art a man of truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:242: "My Sustainer knows fully well what you are doing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:243: But they gave him the lie.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:245: behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:246: But, verily, thy Sustainer – He alone – is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:247: NOW, BEHOLD, this [divine writ] has indeed been bestowed from on high by the Sustainer of all the worlds:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:248: trustworthy divine inspiration has alighted with it from on high
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:249: upon thy heart, [O Muhammad,] so that thou mayest be among those who preach
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:252: is indeed found in the ancient books of divine wisdom [as well].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:253: Is it not evidence enough for them that [so many] learned men from among the children of Israel have recognized this [as true]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:255: had We bestowed it from on high upon any of the non-Arabs,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:256: and had he recited it unto them [in his own tongue], they would not have believed in it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:259: through the hearts of those who are lost in sin:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:260: they will not believe in it till they behold the grievous suffering
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:261: that will come upon them [on resurrection,] all of a sudden, without their being aware [of its approach];
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:262: and then they will exclaim, "Could we have a respite?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:264: wish that Our chastisement be hastened on?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:266: If We do allow them to enjoy [this life] for some years,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:268: which they were promised befalls them
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:269: of what avail to them will be all their past enjoyments?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:270: And withal, never have We destroyed any community unless it had been warned
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:271: and reminded: for never do We wrong .
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:272: And [this divine writ is such a reminder:] no evil spirits have brought it down:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:273: for neither does it suit their ends, nor is it in their power [to impart it to man]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:275: from hearing it are they utterly debarred!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:276: Hence, [O man,] do not invoke any other deity side by side with God, lest thou find thyself among those who are made to suffer [on Judgment Day].
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:277: And warn [whomever thou canst reach, beginning with] thy kinsfolk,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:278: and spread the wings of thy tenderness over all of the believers who may follow thee;
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:279: but if they disobey thee, say, "I am free of responsibility for aught that you may do!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:280: and place thy trust in the Almighty, the Dispenser of Grace,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:281: who sees thee when thou standest ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:283: thy behaviour among those who prostrate themselves [before Him]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:284: for, verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:286: shall I tell you upon whom it is that those evil spirits descend?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:287: They descend upon all sinful self-deceivers
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:288: who readily lend ear [to every falsehood], and most of whom lie to others as well.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:289: And as for the poets – [they, too, are prone to deceive themselves: and so, only] those who are lost in grievous error would follow them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:290: Art thou not aware that they roam confusedly through all the valleys [of words and thoughts],
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:291: and that they [so often] say what they do not do [or feel]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:292: [Most of them are of this kind –] save those who have attained to faith, and do righteous deeds, and remember God unceasingly, and defend themselves
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:293: after having been wronged, and [trust in God’s promise that] those who are bent on wrongdoing will in time come to know how evil a turn their destinies are bound to take!
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:294: ropes and staffs seemed to him to be moving rapidly; and in his heart, Moses became apprehensive”).
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:295: indications of the immorality (fasād) inherent in [the principle of] taqlīd,” i.
Muhammad Asad.verse 26:297: has been mentioned [or “foretold”] in the earlier scriptures” (see in this connection note 33 on 2:42 and – with particular reference to a prediction made by Jesus – note 6 on 61:6).

Martin Lings.verse 26:1: Verily it is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Martin Lings.verse 26:2: Which the faithful Spirit hath brought down.
Martin Lings.verse 26:3: Upon thy heart for thee to be a warner.
Martin Lings.verse 26:4: Warn thy family who are thy nearest of kin.
Martin Lings.verse 26:5: Lower thy wing unto those that follow thee.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:2: These are the verses of the manifest Book.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:3: (O Prophet,) perhaps you are going to let yourself collapse in grief because they do not believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:4: If We so will, We can send down to them a sign from the sky, for which their necks will stay bent in submission.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:5: Never a new message comes to them from the RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah), but they become averse to it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:6: Thus they rejected (the Truth); well, soon will come to them the real descriptions of what they used to ridicule.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:7: Have they not looked at the earth, how many of the noble pairs (of vegetation) We have caused to grow in it?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:8: Surely, in this there is a sign, but most of them are not believers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:9: and indeed your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:10: (Remember) when your Lord called Mūsā saying, “Go to the transgressing people,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:12: He (Mūsā) said, “My Lord, I fear that they will reject me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:13: My heart gets straitened, and my tongue is not fluent; so send for Hārūn.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:14: Moreover, they have (leveled) a charge of offence against me, and I fear they will kill me;”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:15: He (Allah) said, “Never! (They will not be able to kill you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:16: So go, both of you, to Pharaoh and say, ‘We both are messengers of the Lord of all the worlds,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:17: (sent with the message) that you must send the children of Isrā’īl with us’”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:18: He (Pharaoh) said, “Did we not nourish you among us as a child? And you remained amidst us for years,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:19: and you did the blunder you did; still you are ungrateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:20: He said, “I did that at a time when I was mistaken.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:21: Then I fled away from you when I feared you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:22: As for the favor with which you are obliging me, it is that you have enslaved the children of Isrā’īl.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:23: Pharaoh said, “What is the Lord of the worlds?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:24: He (Mūsā) said, “Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever there is between them, if you are to believe”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:25: He (The Pharaoh) said to those around him, “Are you not hearing?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:26: He (Mūsā) said, “Your Lord and the Lord of your early forefathers”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:27: He (Pharaoh) said, “Your messenger who is sent to you is a mad man indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:28: He (Mūsā) said, “Lord of the East and the West and whatever lies between them, if you are to understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:29: He (Pharaoh) said, “If you adopt a God other than me, I will certainly put you to prison.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:30: He (Mūsā) said “Will you (do this) even if I bring to you something evident?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:31: He said, “Then bring it, if you are truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:32: So, he threw down his staff, and in no time it was a serpent, clearly visible,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:33: and he drew out his hand, and right then it was a white light to the onlookers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:34: He (Pharaoh) said to the chiefs around him “This man is certainly an expert sorcerer”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:35: He wants to expel you from your land with his sorcery.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:36: They said, “Leave him and his brother alone for some time, and send heralds to the cities,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:37: so that they bring to you every highly expert sorcerer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:38: So the sorcerers were assembled for the appointed time of a known day,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:39: and it was said to the people, “Would you assemble,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:40: so that we may follow the sorcerers if they are victorious?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:41: So, when the sorcerers came, they said to Pharaoh, “Will there be a sure reward for us, if we are the victorious?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:42: He said, “Yes, and of course, you will then be among the closer ones.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:43: Mūsā said to them, “Throw you down what you are to throw.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:44: So they threw down their ropes and their staffs and said, “By the majesty of Pharaoh, we will be the triumphant for sure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:45: Then Mūsā threw down his staff, and in no time it started swallowing the falsehood they invented.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:46: So the sorcerers were made (by the truth they saw) to fall down in prostration.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:47: They said, “We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:48: the Lord of Mūsā and Hārūn.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:49: He (Pharaoh) said, “You have believed in him before I permit you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:51: We really hope that our Lord will forgive us our faults, as we are the first of the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:52: And We revealed to Mūsā saying, “Make My servants travel at night.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:53: So Pharaoh sent into the cities (his) men to muster (people)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:55: and indeed they are enraging us,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:56: and we are a host, well-armed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:58: and from treasures and a noble abode.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:60: So they (the people of Pharaoh) pursued them (the people of Mūsā) at the time of sunrise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:61: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Mūsā said, “Surely we are overtaken.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:62: He said, “Never! Indeed with me is my Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:63: So We revealed to Mūsā saying, “Strike the sea with your staff.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:64: Then We brought others close to that place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:65: And We saved Mūsā and all those with him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:67: Surely, in this there is a sign, but most of them are not believers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:68: and indeed your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:69: And recite before them the narrative of Ibrāhīm,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:70: when he said to his father and to his people, “What do you worship?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:71: They said, “We worship idols, and stay devoted to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:72: He said, “Do they listen to you when you call (them)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:73: or do they bring benefit to you or harm?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:74: They said, “No, but we have found our fathers doing like this.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:75: He said, “Have you then ever considered what you have been worshipping,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:77: they all are an enemy to me, except the Lord of the worlds,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:78: who created me, and who guides me,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:79: and Who feeds me and gives me drink,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:80: and when I become sick, He heals me,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:81: and who will make me die, then will give me life,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:82: and who, I hope, will forgive my fault on the Day of Retribution.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:83: O my Lord, give me wisdom, and make me join the righteous,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:84: and destine for me a truthful description among the next generations,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:85: and make me among those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:87: and do not put me to disgrace on the Day when all will be raised to life,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:88: the Day when neither wealth will be of any use (to any one) nor sons,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:89: except to him who will come to Allah with a sound heart,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:90: and the Paradise will be brought near to the God-fearing
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:91: and the Hell will be fully uncovered for the perverse,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:92: and it will be said to them, ‘Where is that which you used to worship
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:93: beside Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?’
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:94: So they (their false gods) will be thrown on their faces into it - they and the erring people
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:95: and the entire army of Iblīs (Satan), all together.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:96: They will say when they will be quarreling there with each other,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:97: ‘By Allah, we were in open error
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:98: when we used to equate you with the Lord of the worlds,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:99: and it is only the sinners who misguided us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:100: Now we have neither any intercessors
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:102: Would that we have a chance to return whereby we may join the believers!’”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:103: Surely, in this there is a sign, but most of them are not believers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:104: and indeed your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:105: The people of NūH rejected the messengers
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:106: when their brother NūH said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:107: I am an honest messenger for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:108: So, fear Allah and obey me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:109: I do not claim from you any reward for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:110: so, fear Allah and obey me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:111: They said, “Shall we believe in you while you are followed by the lowest people?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:112: He said, “I do not know about what they do;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:113: their account is with none but with my Lord, if you have sense.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:114: And I am not the one who would drive the believers away;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:115: I am no more than a plain warner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:116: They said, “Should you not stop, O NūH, you will surely be stoned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:117: He said, “My Lord, my people have rejected me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:118: So judge between me and them with an open verdict, and save me and all the believers who are with me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:119: So We saved him and those with him in the Ark that was fully occupied.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:120: Then We drowned, after that, all the remaining.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:121: Surely, in this there is a sign, but most of them are not believers
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:122: and indeed your Lord is the Mighty, the Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:124: when their brother Hūd said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:125: I am an honest messenger for you,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:126: so fear Allah and obey me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:127: I do not claim from you any reward for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:128: Do you erect on every height a monument, having no sound purpose,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:129: and take the objects of architecture as if you are going to live forever,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:130: and when you seize (someone) you seize as tyrants?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:131: So fear Allah and obey me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:132: And fear the One who has supported you with what you know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:133: He has supported you with cattle and sons,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:135: In fact I fear for you the punishment of a horrible day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:136: They said, “It is all equal for us, whether you give us advice or you do not become one of the advisors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:137: This is nothing but the practice of the ancient,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:138: and we are not going to be punished.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:139: Thus they rejected him, so We destroyed them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:140: and indeed your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:141: The (people of) Thamūd rejected the messengers
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:142: when their brother SāliH said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:143: I am an honest messenger for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:144: So, fear Allah and obey me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:145: I do not claim from you any reward for it.
