Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:146: Will you be left secure in whatever is here,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:148: and in farms and date-palms, the spathes of which are interwoven?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:149: You hew out houses from the hills with pride.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:150: So fear Allah and obey me,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:151: and do not obey the order of the transgressors
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:152: who make mischief on the land and who do not set things right”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:153: They said, “You are merely one of those bewitched.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:154: You are nothing but a human like us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:156: So do not touch her with evil (intent), lest you should be seized by a painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:157: But they killed her, then they became remorseful,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:159: and indeed your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:160: The people of LūT rejected the messengers
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:161: when their brother LūT said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:162: I am an honest messenger for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:163: So fear Allah and obey me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:164: I do not claim from you any reward for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:165: Do you go to the males (for having sex) out of the whole universe,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:166: and leave your wives whom your Lord has created for you? Indeed you are a people who cross (all) limits.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:167: They said, “If you do not stop O LūT, you shall be included among the outcast.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:168: He said “Indeed, I am annoyed with your act.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:169: My Lord, save me and my family from what they do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:170: So We saved him and his family, all of them
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:171: except an old woman among those who remained behind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:173: and subjected them to a terrible rain.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:174: Surely, in this there is a sign, but most of them are not believers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:175: and indeed your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:176: The people of Aaikah rejected the messengers
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:177: when Shu‘aib said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:178: I am an honest messenger for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:179: So fear Allah and obey me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:180: And I do not claim from you any reward for it; my reward is with none but with the Lord of the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:181: Give full measure, and do not be among those who bring loss to others.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:183: and do not make people short of their things, and do not spread disorder in the land as mischief-makers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:184: and be fearful of the One who created you and the former generations.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:185: They said, “You are but one of the bewitched men.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:186: You are no more than a human like us, and in fact we consider you to be one of the liars.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:187: So cause a piece from the sky to fall down upon us, if you are one of the truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:188: He said, “My Lord knows well what you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:189: Thus they rejected him, so they were seized by the torment of the Day of Canopy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:190: Surely, in this there is a sign, but most of them are not believers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:191: and indeed your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:192: This (Qur’ān) is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:193: The Trusted Spirit has brought it down
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:194: upon your heart, so that you become one of the warners
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:196: And of course, it is (mentioned) in the Scriptures of the former people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:197: Is it not a proof for them that the knowledgeable of the children of Isrā’īl recognize him (the prophet)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:198: Even if We had revealed it to a Non-Arab,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:199: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:200: This is how We have made it pass through the hearts of the sinners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:201: They will not believe in it until they will see the painful punishment
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:202: and it will come to them suddenly while they will not be anticipating (it),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:203: and (then) they will say, “Is it (possible) that we are given some respite?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:204: Is it then Our punishment that they are trying to hasten up?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:205: So tell me, if We give them enjoyment for years,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:206: then comes to them what they are warned of,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:207: what help can they receive from the comforts they were given to enjoy?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:208: We did not destroy any town unless it has had warners
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:209: to give advice, and We have never been unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:210: And this (Qur’ān) is not brought down by devils.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:211: It neither suits them, nor are they able to (do this).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:212: In fact, they are kept far away from hearing (it at the time of revelation).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:213: So do not invoke any other god along with Allah, otherwise you will be among those who are to be punished.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:214: And warn the nearest people of your clan,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:215: and be kind with humbleness to the believers who followed you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:216: So if they disobey you, then say, “I disown what you do,”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:217: and place your trust in the Mighty, the Merciful,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:218: Who sees you when you stand (in prayer,)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:219: and (sees) your movement among those who prostrate themselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:220: Surely, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:221: Shall I tell you on whom the devils descend?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:222: They descend on every sinful liar.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:223: They give ear to hear (secretly,) and most of them tell lies.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:224: As for the poets, they are followed by the straying people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:225: Did you not see that they wander in every valley,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:226: and that they say what they do not?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 26:227: Except those who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah very much, and defend themselves after they are wronged.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:2: Those are the signs of the Manifest Book.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:3: Perhaps, you might kill yourself that they will not become believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:4: If We will We will send down to them a sign from the heaven before which their necks will remain bowed in humility.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:5: And there would never come to them from the Compassionate One any remembrance that is new, but that they used to disregard it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:6: Verily then they have denied; but soon there will come to them the news of that which they used to deride.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:7: Have they not contemplated the earth, how many We have caused to grow therein of every splendid kind [of vegetation].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:8: Surely in that there is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:9: And surely your Lord, He is the Mighty One, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:10: And when your Lord called to Moses, :
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:12: Pharaoh's folk, will they not show fear?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:13: He said, 'My Lord, I fear they will deny me,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:14: and that anguish will constrain my breast, and that my tongue will not utter clearly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:15: And I have sinned against them and I fear they will slay me'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:16: Said He, 'Certainly not! Go both of you with Our signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:17: So the two of you approach Pharaoh and say, "Indeed We are the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:18: that you should let go forth with us the Children of Israel" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:19: He said, 'Did we not rear you among us as a child, and did you not stay with us for years of your life?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:20: And you committed that deed of yours being an ingrate'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:21: He said, 'I did that then, when I was astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:22: So I fled from you, as I was afraid of you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:23: That is a favour with which you now reproach me that you have enslaved the Children of Israel'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:24: Pharaoh said, 'And what is "the Lord of the Worlds?" '
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:25: He said, 'The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them should you have conviction'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:26: He said to those who were around him, 'Did you not hear?!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:27: He said, 'Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:28: He said, 'Verily this messenger of yours sent to you is a madman!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:29: He said, 'The Lord of the east and the west and all that is between them - should you comprehend'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:30: He said, 'If you choose any god other than me, I will surely make you a prisoner!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:31: He said, 'What if I bring you something manifest?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:32: He said, 'Then bring it, if you are truthful'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:33: So he threw down his staff, and lo! it was a manifest serpent.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:34: Then he drew out his hand and lo! it was white before the onlookers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:35: He said to the council around him, 'Surely this man is a cunning sorcerer,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:36: who seeks to expel you from your land by his sorcery.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:37: They said, 'Put him and his brother off for a while and send musterers into the cities
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:38: to bring you every cunning sorcerer'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:39: So the sorcerers were assembled at a fixed time of a known day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:40: And it was said to the people, 'Will you assemble!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:41: Maybe we will follow the sorcerers, should they be the victors'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:42: So when the sorcerers came, they said to Pharaoh, 'Shall we indeed have a reward if we were to be the victors?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:43: He said, 'Yes [of course]! And you shall then be among those closest [to me]'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:44: Moses said to them, 'Cast what you have to cast'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:45: So they cast their ropes and their staffs, and said, 'By the power of Pharaoh we shall surely be the victors!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:46: Thereat Moses cast his staff and lo! it was swallowing what they had faked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:47: So the sorcerers fell down prostrating.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:48: They said, 'We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:49: the Lord of Moses and Aaron'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:50: Pharaoh said, 'Do you believe him, though I have not given you leave? He is indeed your chief, the one who has taught you sorcery.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:51: They said, 'There is no harm [in that].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:52: Indeed We hope our Lord will forgive us our iniquities, for being the first to believe'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:54: 'Journey with My servants by night, for indeed you will be pursued'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:55: Then Pharaoh sent to the cities musterers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:56: 'Lo! these are but a small gang.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:57: And indeed they have enraged us,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:58: and indeed we are all on our guard.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:59: So We made them go forth from gardens, and springs,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:61: So [it was], and We made the Children of Israel to inherit these.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:62: Then they pursued them at sunrise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:63: And when the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, 'We have been caught!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:64: He said, 'Certainly not! indeed I have my Lord with me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:65: Thereupon We revealed to Moses: 'Strike the sea with your staff', whereupon it parted, and each part was as a mighty mountain.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:66: And there We brought near the others.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:67: And We delivered Moses and all those who were with him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:69: Surely in that there is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:70: And surely your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:71: And recite to them the tiding of Abraham
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:72: when he said to his father and his people, 'What do you worship?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:73: They said, 'We worship idols and remain cleaving to them'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:74: He said, 'Do they hear you when you supplicate?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:75: Or do they bring you benefit or harm?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:76: They said, 'Rather, we found our fathers so doing'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:77: He said, 'Have you considered what you have been worshipping,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:79: They are indeed hateful to me, but the Lord of the Worlds,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:81: Who created me, it is He Who guides me,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:82: and provides me with food and drink,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:83: and when I am sick, it is He Who cures me;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:84: and Who will make me die, then give me life,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:85: and Who, I hope, will forgive me my iniquity on the Day of Judgement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:87: judgement and unite me with the righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:88: And confer on me a worthy repute among posterity.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:89: And make me among the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:90: And forgive my father, for indeed he is one of those who are astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:91: And do no disgrace me on the day when they are resurrected;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:92: the day when neither wealth nor children will avail,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:93: except him who comes to God with a heart that is sound.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:94: And Paradise will be brought near for the God-fearing,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:97: And it will be said to them, 'Where is that which you used to worship
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:98: besides God? Do they help you, or do they help one another?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:99: Then they will be hurled into it, they and the perverse,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:100: and the hosts of Iblīs, all together.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:101: They shall say, as they wrangle therein,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:102: 'By God, we had indeed been in manifest error,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:103: when we equated you with the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:104: And it was none other than the sinners that led us astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:108: If only we had another turn, we would have been among those who believe!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:109: Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:110: And truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:111: The people of Noah denied the messengers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:112: when Noah, their brother said to them, 'Will you not fear ?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:113: Truly I am a trusted messenger
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:115: So fear God and obey me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:116: I do not ask of you any reward for it; for my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:117: So fear God and obey me'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:118: They said, 'Shall we believe in you, when it is the lowliest people who follow you?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:119: He said, 'And what do I know of what they may have been doing?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:120: Their reckoning is only my Lord's concern, if only you were aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:121: And I am not about to drive away the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:122: I am just a plain warner'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:123: They said, 'Lo! if you do not desist, O Noah, you will assuredly be among those assailed'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:124: He said, 'My Lord, my people have denied me,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:125: so judge conclusively between me and them, and deliver me and the believers who are with me'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:126: So We delivered him and those who were with him in the laden ark.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:128: Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:129: Truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:131: when Hūd, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not fear God?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:132: Truly I am a trusted messenger
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:134: So fear God and obey me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:135: I do not ask of you any reward for this; for my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:136: Do you build on every prominence a monument so that you may hurl abuse?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:137: And you set up structures that perhaps you might last forever.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:138: And when you assault, you assault like tyrants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:139: So fear God, and obey me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:140: And fear Him Who has provided you, in a way that you know,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:141: provided you with cattle and sons,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:143: Indeed I fear for you the chastisement of a tremendous day'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:144: They said, 'It is the same to us whether you admonish
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:145: or are not one of those who admonish.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:146: This is merely the fabrication of the ancients,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:147: and we will not be chastised'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:148: So they denied him, whereupon We destroyed them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:149: Truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:151: when Sālih, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you fear God?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:152: Truly I am a trusted messenger
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:154: So fear God and obey me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:155: I do not ask of you any reward for this; for my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:156: Will you be left secure in that which is here,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:158: and farms and date palms with slender spathes?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:159: And you hew dwellings out of the mountains arrogantly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:160: So fear God and obey me,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:161: and do not obey the command of the prodigal,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:162: who cause corruption in the earth, and act righteously'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:163: They said, 'You are indeed one of the bewitched.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:164: And you are just a human being like us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:165: a sign, if you are sincere'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:166: He said, 'This is a she-camel; she shall drink, and you shall drink
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:168: And do not cause her any harm, for then you shall be seized by the chastisement of an awful day'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:169: But they hamstrung her, and then became remorseful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:170: So they were seized by the chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:171: Truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:172: The people of Lot denied the messengers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:173: when Lot, their brother, said to them, 'Will you not fear God?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:174: Truly I am a trusted messenger
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:176: So fear God and obey me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:177: I do not ask of you any reward for this; my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:178: What! Of all people you come unto males [to fornicate],
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:179: and forsake the wives your Lord has created for you? Nay, but you are a transgressing folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:180: They said, 'If you do not desist, O Lot, you will assuredly be of those expelled'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:181: He, said, 'Truly I abhor what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:182: My Lord, deliver me and my family from what they do'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:183: So We delivered him and all his family,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:184: except an old woman among those who stayed behind.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:187: and We rained on them a rain, and evil was the rain of those who were warned!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:188: Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:189: Surely your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:190: The dwellers in the wood denied the messengers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:191: when Shu‘ayb said to them, ‘Will you not fear God?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:192: Truly I am a trusted messenger
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:194: So fear God and obey me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:195: I do not ask of you any reward for this; indeed my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:196: Give full measure and do not be of those who give short measure,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:197: and weigh with an even balance,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:198: and do not defraud people in their goods, and do not be degenerate in the earth, seeking corruption.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:199: And fear Him Who created you and the former generations'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:200: They said, 'You are indeed one of the bewitched.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:201: You are just a human being like us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:202: Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us, if you are of the truthful'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:203: He said, 'My Lord knows best what you are doing'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:204: But they denied him, so they were seized by the chastisement of the day of the shade.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:205: Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:206: Surely your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:207: Truly it is the revelation of the Lord of the Worlds,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:208: brought down by the Trustworthy Spirit,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:209: upon your heart, that you may be
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:212: And truly it is in the Scriptures of the ancients.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:213: Is it not a sign for them that the learned of the Children of Israel recognise it?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:214: For had We revealed it to some non-Arabs,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:215: and had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:216: So We have caused it to penetrate the hearts of the criminals.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:217: They will not believe in it until they behold the painful chastisement,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:218: so that it will come upon them suddenly while they are not aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:219: Thereupon they will say, 'Shall we be granted any respite?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:220: So do they [seek to] hasten Our chastisement?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:222: then: If We were to let them enjoy
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:225: then there were to come on them that which they have been promised,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:226: in what way would that enjoyment which they were given avail them?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:227: And We have not destroyed any town but it had warners,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:228: as a reminder, for We were never unjust.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:229: It has not been brought down by the devils.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:230: Neither would it behove them, nor are they capable.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:231: Truly they are barred from the hearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:232: So do not invoke any other god with God, lest you be among the chastised.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:233: And warn the nearest of your kinsfolk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:234: And lower your wing to the believers who follow you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:235: But if they disobey you, say, 'I am absolved of what you do'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:236: And put your trust in the Mighty, the Merciful,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:237: Who sees you when you stand,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:238: and your movements among those who prostrate.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:240: Truly He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:241: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:242: They descend upon every sinful liar.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:244: but most of them are liars.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:247: Have you not noticed that in every valley they rove
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:248: and that they say what they do not do?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 26:249: Save those who believe and perform righteous deeds and remember God frequently and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged, and those who are wrongdoers will soon know the reversal with which they will meet.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:2: These are the Verses of the Book that makes clear (the truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:3: (O Esteemed Beloved!) You will perhaps risk your (dearest) life, (grieving) that they do not accept faith.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:4: If We intend, We should send down upon them (such) a sign from heaven as their necks would not but bow down before it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:5: And there does not come to them any new admonition from the Most Kind (Lord) but they turn away from it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:6: Thus they have indeed denied (the truth), so the news of what they used to make fun of will reach them soon.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:7: And have they not discerned the earth—what a variety of excellent vegetation We have caused to grow in it?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:8: Surely, there is a sign in it (of Allah’s might), but most of them are not the ones to believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:9: And assuredly, your Lord alone is the Almighty, Ever-Merciful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:10: And (recall) when your Lord called to Musa (Moses): ‘Go to the wrongdoing people;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:12: Musa (Moses) submitted: ‘O my Lord, I fear that they will reject me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:13: And my breast constricts (under such adverse circumstances) and my tongue does not express (fluently), so send (Gabriel with revelation) to Harun (
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:14: as well so that he becomes my helper).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:15: And they also have a charge against me (of killing a Copt), so I fear they may kill me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:16: (Allah) said: ‘By no means, so go both of you, with Our signs.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:17: So go, both of you, to Pharaoh and say: We are the Messengers (sent) by the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:18: (Our aim is that) you send the Children of Israel with us (setting them free).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:19: Pharaoh said: ‘Did we not bring you up amongst us as a child, and you spent many years of your life with us?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:20: And (then) you committed that deed which you committed (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:22: said: ‘When I did that deed, I was unaware (that even a single blow would take his life).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:23: So (at that time), I went out of your (line of control) when I feared your (designs).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:24: And is that (any) favour of which you are reminding me? (That happened also because) you had enslaved (all my people) the Children of Israel.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:25: (Pharaoh) said: ‘What is the Lord of all the worlds?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:27: said: ‘(He) is the Lord of all the heavens and the earth and the (whole universe) between the two if you are a firm believer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:28: He said to those seated around him: ‘Are you not listening?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:30: added: ‘(The One Who) is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers (too).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:31: (Pharaoh) said: ‘Surely, your Messenger that has been sent to you is but insane.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:33: said: ‘(He) is the Lord of the east and the west, and (the whole universe) between the two if you have (some) sense.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:35: if you take a god other than me, I will certainly (arrest and) put you amongst the prisoners.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:37: said: ‘Even if I bring you something manifest (also as a miracle)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:38: (Pharaoh) said: ‘Bring it if you are truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:39: So Musa (Moses) put his staff down (on the ground) and that, at once, became a serpent, evidently clear.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:41: brought out his hand (after putting it under his armpit) and there it became radiant white to the viewers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:42: (Pharaoh) said to the chiefs (sitting) around him: ‘Undoubtedly, he is a (highly) learned sorcerer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:43: He seeks to drive you out of your land by (the force of) his magic.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:44: They said: ‘Put off (the announcement of sentence for) him and his brother (Harun )
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:45: and send callers to (all) the cities (to summon the sorcerers).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:46: They will bring you every high ranking, expert sorcerer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:47: So all the sorcerers were assembled at the appointed time on the fixed day.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:48: And it was said to the people (from Pharaoh’s side): ‘You will assemble together (on this occasion),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:49: So that we may follow (the din
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:50: of) the sorcerers if they overmaster (Musa
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:52: Then when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Pharaoh: ‘Is there (also) any reward (fixed) for us if we gain the upper hand (in the contest)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:53: (Pharaoh) said: ‘Yes indeed! (Instead of the rewarded ones,) you will straight away join (my) closer circle (and intimate relationship is far higher in grade than reward).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:54: ( Musa [ Moses]) said to those (sorcerers): ‘Throw down the (magic) items which you are about to throw.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:55: So they cast down their strings and sticks and said: ‘By the honour of Pharaoh, we shall certainly win.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:56: Then Musa (Moses) cast down his staff which, (changing into a serpent,) began swallowing up those things which they had made look different (from reality) through trickery.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:57: So, all the magicians fell down prostrating themselves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:58: They said: ‘We believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:59: The Lord of Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:60: (Pharaoh) said: ‘You have believed in Him before I granted you permission.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:61: who is your chief (coach) and who has taught you magic.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:62: They said: ‘There is no harm (in it).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:63: We have strong hope that our Lord will forgive our sins since it is we who are the first to believe (now).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:64: And We revealed to Musa (Moses): ‘Take away My servants (from here) by night; you will certainly be chased.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:65: Then Pharaoh sent callers to the cities.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:66: (And he conveyed:) ‘Surely, these (Children of Israel) are but a small party.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:67: And undoubtedly, they are provoking us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:68: And verily, we all are (also) alert and vigilant.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:69: Then We drove them (Pharaoh’s people) out of gardens and springs,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:70: And (also expelled them) from treasures and refined dwellings.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:71: So (We did) and made the Children of Israel inheritors of all (those bounties).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:72: Then at sunrise, they (Pharaoh’s people) chased them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:73: So when the two parties came face to face, the companions of Musa (Moses) said: ‘(Now) we are sure to be caught.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:75: said: ‘Never! Surely, my Lord is with me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:76: Then We revealed to Musa (Moses): ‘Strike the sea with your staff.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:77: And We brought the other party (Pharaoh and his companions) closer to that place.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:78: And We saved Musa (Moses) and (also) all those who were with him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:80: Surely, in this (incident), there is a great sign (of Allah’s Infinite Power).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:81: And verily, your Lord alone is Almighty, Ever-Merciful indeed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:82: And also recite to them the story of Ibrahim (Abraham).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:83: When he said to his father
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:84: They said: ‘We worship idols and remain stuck to their (worship and care).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:86: said: ‘Do they hear you when you call (them)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:87: Or do they bring you any profit or loss?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:88: They said: ‘(We do not know that) but we found our fathers doing the same.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:90: said: ‘Have you (ever) thought (of their reality) you worship?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:91: (Did) you or (any of) your forefathers (ever realize)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:92: So (all) these (idols) are enemies to me except the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:93: He Who created me and He is the One Who guides me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:94: And He is the One Who provides me with food and drink.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:95: And when I fall ill, He is the One Who cures me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:96: And He is the One Who will cause me to die and then He alone will give me life (again),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:97: And Who, I hope, will forgive me my misdeeds on the Day of Judgment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:98: O my Lord! Bless me with excellence in knowledge and deeds, and include me amongst those who deserve Your exceptional intimacy.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:99: And ordain for me virtuous remembrance and acceptance amongst the coming generations (too).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:100: And include me amongst the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:102: And disgrace me not on the Day (when) people will be raised up (from the graves),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:103: The Day when neither wealth nor sons will profit.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:104: But he alone (will be the gainer) who appears before the presence of Allah with a heart protected (from) and pure (of all evils).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:105: And (on that Day) Paradise will be brought closer to the Godfearing (and self-protecting).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:106: And Hell will be uncovered before the misguided.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:107: And it will be said to them: ‘Where are those (idols) which you used to worship,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:108: Besides Allah? Can they help you, or can they help themselves (to protect themselves from Hell)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:109: So into Hell will be thrown headlong (the idols as well as) the people who lost the straight road.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:110: And all the troops of Iblis (too will be hurled into Hell).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:111: Those (misguided people) will say whilst disputing amongst themselves (in the Hell):
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:112: ‘By Allah, we were in manifest error,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:113: When we held you equal to the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:114: And no other than (these) evildoers led us astray.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:115: So we do not have any intercessor (Today).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:116: Nor do we have any passionate friend.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:117: Alas! If once we could have (a chance to) return (to the world), we would become believers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:118: Surely, in this (incident), there is a great sign (of Allah’s Infinite Power).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:119: And verily, your Lord alone is Almighty, Ever-Merciful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:120: The people of Nuh (Noah also) rejected the Messengers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:121: When their (kinship) brother Nuh (Noah) said to them: ‘Do you not fear (Allah)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:122: Indeed, I (have come as) a trustworthy Messenger to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:123: So fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:124: And I do not demand of you any wages for this (preaching of the truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:125: So fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:126: They said: ‘Should we believe in you whilst the people of the lowest and most worthless (classes of society) are following you?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:128: said: ‘What has my knowledge to do with their (professional) tasks?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:129: Their account is only with my Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:130: And I am not the one who casts out the believers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:131: I am only a clear Warner.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:132: They said: ‘O Nuh (Noah), if you do not stop (saying these things), then surely you will be stoned to death.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:134: submitted: ‘O my Lord, my people have rejected me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:135: So judge between me and them, and deliver me and the believers who are in my company.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:136: So We delivered him and those who were (aboard) with him in the fully loaded Ark.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:137: Then thereafter We drowned all the rest.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:138: Surely, in this (incident), there is a great sign (of Allah’s Infinite Power) and most of them were not the believers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:139: And verily, your Lord alone is Almighty, Ever-Merciful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:141: When their (kinship) brother Hud said to them: ‘Do you not fear (Allah)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:142: Verily, I (have come as) a trustworthy Messenger to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:143: So fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:144: And I do not demand of you any wages for this (preaching of the truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:145: Do you build a monument on every high point (merely) for vanity and vain pursuits?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:146: And do you erect strongly-built palaces (having pools) with the hope of living (in the world) forever?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:147: And when you lay hand on someone, you do it like ruthless tyrants.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:148: So fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:149: And fear Him (Allah) Who has helped you with the things which you know.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:150: He has helped you with cattle and children,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:152: Surely, I fear the torment of a Terrible Day coming upon you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:153: They said: ‘It is all the same to us whether you admonish, or do not become of those who admonish (we shall not believe).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:154: It is nothing (else) but the habits (and customs) of the ancients (which we cannot abandon).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:155: And we shall not be afflicted with the torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:156: So they rejected him (Hud) and We destroyed them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:157: And verily, your Lord alone is Almighty, Ever-Merciful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:158: (The people of) Thamud (also) rejected the Messengers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:159: When Salih, their (kinship) brother, said to them: ‘Do you not fear (Allah)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:160: Verily, I (have come as) a trustworthy Messenger to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:161: So fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:162: And I do not demand of you any wages for this (preaching of the truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:163: Will you be left in peace and contentment (forever) in these (bounties) which are (available to you) here?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:165: And in crops and palm-trees which have soft and fine blossoms?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:166: And, skilled (in stone-carving), you carve out houses in the mountains.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:167: So fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:168: And do not obey the instructions of those who exceed limits,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:169: Those who spread destructive activities in the land and do not do constructive works (for society).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:170: They said: ‘You are but of the magic-stricken people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:171: You are but a human being like us, so bring some sign if you are truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:173: And do not touch her with evil (intention), or the torment of a (gravely) terrible day will seize you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:174: But they hamstrung her (and killed her).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:176: And verily, your Lord alone is Almighty, Ever-Merciful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:177: (The people of) Lut (Lot) also rejected the Messengers,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:178: When Lut (Lot), their (kinship) brother, said to them: ‘Do you not fear (Allah)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:179: Verily, I (have come as) a trustworthy Messenger to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:180: So fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:181: And I do not demand of you any wages for this (preaching of the truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:182: Do you approach only males (to satisfy your sexual desire) from amongst the people of the world;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:183: And you leave your wives your Lord has created for you? You are rather of those who exceed bounds (in transgression).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:184: They said: ‘O Lut (Lot), if you do not stop (saying these things), you will surely become of the exiled.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:186: said: ‘No doubt I am of those who are disgusted by your practice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:187: O Lord! Deliver me and my family from (the consequent suffering of) this practice which they are doing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:188: So We delivered him and his entire family,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:189: Except for an old woman who was amongst those who stayed behind.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:192: Surely, in this (incident), there is a great sign and most of them were not believers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:193: And verily, your Lord alone is Almighty, Ever-Merciful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:195: When Shu‘ayb said to them: ‘Do you not fear (Allah)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:196: Verily, I (have come as) a trustworthy Messenger to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:197: So fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:198: And I do not demand of you any wages for this (preaching of the truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:199: Always fill up full measure and do not become injurious (to the rights of the people).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:200: And weigh with a straight balance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:201: And do not give to the people their things (weighing) less than what is due, nor provoke strife in the land (by such moral, economic and social corruption and fraud).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:202: And fear Him (Allah) Who has created you and the former generations.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:203: They said: ‘(O Shu‘ayb,) you are but of the magic-stricken people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:204: And you are but a human being like us, and surely we consider you amongst the liars.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:205: So, make a piece of heaven fall on us if you are truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:206: (Shu‘ayb) said: ‘My Lord knows best these (frauds) which you are doing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:207: So they rejected Shu‘ayb, and the torment of the Day of Shadow seized them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:208: Surely, in this (incident), there is a great sign and most of them were not believers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:209: And verily, your Lord alone is Almighty, Ever-Merciful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:210: And indeed, this Qur’an has been revealed by the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:211: The Trusted Spirit (Gabriel) has descended with it,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:212: Upon your (most illumined) heart so that you may be a Warner (to the disobedient).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:213: (It is sent down) in the plain Arabic language.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:214: And verily, it is (also mentioned) in the scriptures of the former communities.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:215: And is it not for them a (sufficient) proof (of the truth of the Qur’an and the truth of Muhammad’s Prophethood [blessings and peace be upon him]) that the learned scholars of the Children of Israel (also) recognize it?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:216: And if We had sent it down to any of the non-Arabs,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:217: And he had recited it to these people, (even then) they would not have believed in it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:218: Thus have We forced its (denial) firmly into the hearts of the sinners.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:219: They will not believe in it until they see the painful torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:220: So that (torment) will come upon them all of a sudden, and they will not (even) perceive it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:221: They will then say: ‘Shall we be given respite?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:222: Do they seek to hasten Our punishment?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:223: Tell Me, if We provide them benefit for years,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:224: Then comes to them that (torment) which they are being promised,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:225: Then what will those resources which they were utilizing do (to drive that torment away from them)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:226: And We have not destroyed any town except those (towns) for which Warners had come,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:227: (And that too) for direction and guidance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:228: And it is not satans who descended with this (Qur’an).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:229: They are neither worthy nor capable (of it).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:230: Surely, they have been debarred from hearing (this divine communication).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:231: So, (O My servant,) do not call upon any other god besides Allah lest you become of those who are punished.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:232: And, (O Esteemed Beloved,) warn your close relatives (of Our torment).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:233: And extend your (merciful, kind and supporting) hand to those believers who follow you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:234: But, if they disobey you, then say: ‘I am disgusted by these (evil) deeds which you are doing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:235: And put your trust in Almighty, Ever-Merciful (Lord),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:236: Who sees you when you stand up (for Tahajjud Prayer in the solitary hours at night),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:237: And Who (also keeps) seeing your turning movements amongst those who prostrate themselves in Prayer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:239: Shall I tell you upon whom the satans descend?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:240: They descend on every lying sinner (who weaves false allegations),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:241: Who pour (into their ears) hearsay and most of them are liars.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:242: And only the digressers follow the poets.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:243: Have you not seen that these (poets) wander distracted (purposelessly) in every valley (of reflections? They take little serious and true interest in reality.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:244: And that they say (such things) that they do not (themselves) do,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 26:245: Except for those (poets) who believe and do pious deeds persistently and remember Allah abundantly (i.

null.verse 26:2: Nämä ovat säkeitä Ilmestyksen kirjasta.
null.verse 26:3: Joudutko epätoivoon, koska he eivät tahdo uskoa?
null.verse 26:4: Jos olisimme tahtonut, olisimme voinut lähettää heille taivaasta merkin, jonka edessä heidän niskansa olisivat taipuneet.
null.verse 26:5: Jokaisen uuden merkin tullessa laupiaalta Armahtajalta he kääntävät selkänsä.
null.verse 26:6: Nyt he tosin hylkäävät ne valheena, mutta totuus, jolle he ovat ilkkuneet, on pian heidät yllättävä.
null.verse 26:7: Eivätkö he katso maata; kuinka monenlaista ja oivallista Me olemmekaan siinä kasvattanut!
null.verse 26:8: Totisesti, tässä on heille merkki, mutta useimmat heistä eivät ota uskoakseen.
null.verse 26:9: Totisesti Hän, Herrasi, on mahtava, armollisin.
null.verse 26:10: Muista, miten Herrasi kutsui Mooseksen sanoen: »Mene väärämielisen kansan
null.verse 26:11: faraon kansan luokse.
null.verse 26:12: Hän vastasi: »Herra, pelkään heidän minut vääräksi väittävän;
null.verse 26:13: rintaani ahdistaa eikä kieleni ole nopea puhumaan.
null.verse 26:14: Olen myös rikkonut heitä vastaan, niin että pelkään heidän surmaavan minut.
null.verse 26:15: Herra sanoi: »Sitä älä pelkää.
null.verse 26:16: Menkää siis faraon eteen ja sanokaa: »Totisesti, Me olemme tuomassa maailmojen Herran sanaa,
null.verse 26:17: että päästäisit israelilaiset meidän mukanamme.
null.verse 26:18: Farao vastasi: »Emmekö me sinua lapsena kasvattaneet keskuudessamme, ja etkö viettänyt luonamme useita elämäsi vuosia?
null.verse 26:19: Mutta sinä teit rikoksen, ja olet perin kiittämätön.
null.verse 26:20: Hän vastasi: »Tein sen silloin, kun vielä olin oikeata ymmärrystä vailla.
null.verse 26:21: Niin pakeninkin luotanne, koska pelkäsin teitä, mutta sitten on Herra antanut minulle viisautta ja tehnyt minusta sanansaattajansa.
null.verse 26:22: Mutta sitäkö minulle muistutat suosionasi, että olet orjuuttanut israelilaiset?»
null.verse 26:23: Farao sanoi: »Kuka on se »maailmojen Herra»?
null.verse 26:24: Mooses vastasi: »Hän on taivaitten ja maan ja kaiken näiden välillä olevan Herra, jos se teitä vakuuttaa.
null.verse 26:25: Ja Farao lausui ympärillä oleville: »Ettekö kuule?»
null.verse 26:26: Mooses sanoi: »Hän on teidän ja esi~isienne Herra.
null.verse 26:27: Farao lausui: »Totisesti, sananjulistaja, joka on luoksenne lähetetty, on hullu mies.
null.verse 26:28: Mooses sanoi edelleen: »Hän on idän ja lännen ja kaiken näiden välillä olevan Herra; jospa sen vain käsittäisitte.
null.verse 26:29: Farao sanoi: »Jos otat jumalaksesi jonkun muun kuin minut, panen sinut vankien joukkoon.
null.verse 26:30: Mooses vastasi: »Entä, jos tuon sinulle ilmeisen todistuksen?»
null.verse 26:31: Hän sanoi: »Tuo se, jos olet totuudessa.
null.verse 26:32: Silloin Mooses heitti sauvansa maahan, ja katso, se muuttui käärmeeksi.
null.verse 26:33: Sitten hän ojensi kätensä, ja katso, se näytti katsojista vaikealta.
null.verse 26:34: Silloin farao lausui ympärillään oleville päämiehille: »Totta tosiaan, hän on taitava velho,
null.verse 26:35: joka noituudellaan tahtoo karkoittaa teidät maastanne Mitä siis neuvotte?»
null.verse 26:36: He vastasivat: »Anna hänen veljinensä odottaa ja lähetä sanansaattajia kaupunkeihin
null.verse 26:37: noutamaan eteesi kaikki etevät taikurit.
null.verse 26:38: Kun sitten taikurit oli määräpäivänä koottu tiettyyn paikkaan,
null.verse 26:39: niin kansalle ilmoitettiin: »Kerääntykää tekin paikalle,
null.verse 26:40: jotta voimme seurata taikureita; ehkä he voittavat.
null.verse 26:41: Kun taikurit olivat saapuneet, he lausuivat faraolle: »Saammeko palkinnon, jos voitamme?»
null.verse 26:42: Hän vastasi: »Saatte, ja totisesti kuulutte lähimpieni joukkoon.
null.verse 26:43: Mooses lausui heille: »Heittäkää maahan, mitä teillä on heittämistä!»
null.verse 26:44: Niin he heittivät maahan köytensä ja sauvansa ja sanoivat: »Totisesti, faraon voimalla voitamme.
null.verse 26:45: Silloin Mooses heitti maahan oman sauvansa, ja katso, se nieli kaiken, mitä he olivat loihtineet esiin.
null.verse 26:46: Silloin taikurit lankesivat maahan kumartaen.
null.verse 26:47: He sanoivat: »Me uskomme maailmojen Herraan,
null.verse 26:49: Farao lausui: »Uskotteko te häneen, ennen kuin minä sen sallin? Varmasti hän on päämiehenne, joka on teille opettanut noituutta, mutta sen te tulette näkemään.
null.verse 26:50: He vastasivat: »Se ei ole pahaksi; sillä palaamme totisesti Herramme luokse.
null.verse 26:51: Toivomme hartaasti, että Herra antaa meille syntimme anteeksi, koska olemme ensimmäisiä, jotka uskovat.
null.verse 26:52: Me ilmestyimme Moosekselle sanoen: »Lähde matkaan yöllä palvelijoitteni kanssa, sillä teitä varmasti ajetaan takaa.
null.verse 26:53: Mutta farao lähetti sanansaattajia kaupunkeihin, ja he sanoivat.
null.verse 26:54: Totisesti, näitä ihmisiä on vain pieni joukko,
null.verse 26:55: ja katso, he ovat meille vihaisia,
null.verse 26:56: mutta meitä on valpas, asekuntoinen joukko.
null.verse 26:57: Niin Me saimme heidät lähtemään puutarhoista ja lähteiden luota,
null.verse 26:58: aarteittensa äärestä ja upeista asunnoistaan.
null.verse 26:59: Niin tapahtui, mutta tämän kaiken Me annoimme perinnöksi israelilaisille Kanaanin maassa.
null.verse 26:60: Sitten he seurasivat israelilaisia auringon noustessa,
null.verse 26:61: jolloin kumpikin sotajoukko näki toisensa ja Mooseksen seuralaiset sanoivat: »Totisesti, meidät oh yllätetty.
null.verse 26:62: Mutta Mooses lausui: »Ei suinkaan.
null.verse 26:63: Ja me ilmestyimme Moosekselle sanoen: »Lyö sauvallasi merta!» Silloin meri jakautui kahtia, niin että kummallakin puolella kohosi kuin vesiseinä.
null.verse 26:64: Sitten annoimme toisten lähestyä paikkaa.
null.verse 26:65: Ja Me pelastimme Mooseksen ja kaikki ne, jotka olivat hänen kanssaan.
null.verse 26:66: Mutta Me hukutimme nuo toiset.
null.verse 26:67: Totisesti, tässä on merkki, mutta useimmat ihmiset eivät usko.
null.verse 26:68: Totisesti Hän, sinun Herrasi, on kaikkivaltias, kaikkein armollisin.
null.verse 26:69: Kerro heille myös Aabrahamin tarina.
null.verse 26:70: Kun hän puhui isälleen ja kansalleen: »Ketä te palvelette?»
null.verse 26:71: he vastasivat: »Me palvelemme jumalankuvia ja aiomme pysyä niille uskollisina.
null.verse 26:72: Hän kysyi: »Kuulevatko ne, kun te niitä rukoilette?
null.verse 26:73: Tai onko niistä teille hyötyä tai vahinkoa?»
null.verse 26:74: He vastasivat: »Ei, mutta näimme esi-isiemme niin tehneen.
null.verse 26:75: Hän sanoi: »Oletteko sitten ajatelleet, mitä te oikeastaan palvelette,
null.verse 26:76: te ja teidän muinaiset esi-isänne?
null.verse 26:77: Sillä totisesti, ne ovat minun vihollisiani kaikki tyynni; mutta ei maailmojen Herra,
null.verse 26:78: Hän, joka minut loi ja antoi sitten johdatuksensa.
null.verse 26:79: Hän joka antaa minulle syötävää sekä juotavaa.
null.verse 26:80: Ja sairastaessani Hän parantaa minut.
null.verse 26:81: Hän, joka saattaa minut kuolemaan ja sitten antaa minulle elämän.
null.verse 26:82: Ja joka toivoni mukaan antaa anteeksi syntini tuomiopäivänä.
null.verse 26:83: Herra! Suo minulle viisautta ja liitä minut hyvien joukkoon!
null.verse 26:84: Jätä minusta totuuden maine tuleviin sukupolviin
null.verse 26:85: ja tee minusta autuuden tarhan perillinen.
null.verse 26:86: Anna anteeksi isälleni, sillä totisesti hän on harhassa.
null.verse 26:87: Älä saata minua häpeään ylösnousemuksen päivänä,
null.verse 26:88: päivänä, jolloin ei rakkaudesta eikä pojista ole mitään hyötyä,
null.verse 26:89: paitsi sille, joka lähestyy Jumalaa hartain sydämin.
null.verse 26:90: Puutarha avautuu niille, jotka pahaa karttavat,
null.verse 26:91: mutta eksyneiden eteen ilmaantuu helvetti.
null.verse 26:92: Heille sanotaan: »Missä ovat ne, joita te palvelitte
null.verse 26:93: Jumalan sijasta? Voivatko he teitä auttaa tai edes itseänsä suojella?»
null.verse 26:94: Heidät heitetään helvettiin, sekä heidät että ne, jotka eksyivät,
null.verse 26:95: ja saatanan sotajoukko, kaikki tyynni.
null.verse 26:96: Siellä he kiistelevät keskenänsä ja sanovat:
null.verse 26:97: »Jumalan nimessä, olemme todellakin olleet ilmeisen harhan vallassa,
null.verse 26:98: kun me pidimme teitä maailmojen Herran vertaisina.
null.verse 26:99: Juuri syntiset johtivat meidät harhaan.
null.verse 26:100: Ja nyt meillä ei ole ketään auttajaa,
null.verse 26:101: eikä yhtäkään tosi ystävää.
null.verse 26:102: Jos saisimme vielä palata elämään, tulisimme uskovaisiksi.
null.verse 26:103: Totisesti, tässä on opetus, mutta useimmat heistä eivät usko.
null.verse 26:104: Totisesti, Hän, sinun Herrasi, on kaikkivaltias, kaikkein armollisin.
null.verse 26:105: Nooan kansa piti lähettiläitä valehtelijoina.
null.verse 26:106: Nooa, heidän heimolaisensa, sanoi heille: »Ettekö pelkää Jumalaa?
null.verse 26:107: Totisesti, minä olen teille luotettava sananjulistaja.
null.verse 26:108: Sentähden palvelkaa Jumalaa ja totelkaa minua.
null.verse 26:109: Teiltä en pyydä siitä mitään palkkaa.
null.verse 26:110: Pelätkää siis Jumalaa ja totelkaa minua!»
null.verse 26:111: He vastasivat: »Pitäisikö meidän uskoa sinua, kun vain halvimmat ihmiset sinua seuraavat?»
null.verse 26:112: Hän sanoi: »Ei minun tarvitse tietää, mitä on heidän tekojensa takana.
null.verse 26:113: Heidän tutkimisensa on yksin Herran asia, jospa sen ymmärtäisitte!
null.verse 26:114: Minä en aio karkoittaa uskovaisia luotani.
null.verse 26:115: Olen vain julkinen varoittaja.
null.verse 26:116: He uhkasivat: »Totisesti, ellet jo herkeä, oi Nooa, niin sinut varmasti kivitetään.
null.verse 26:117: Hän rukoili:»Herra, tosiaankin on kansani minut hylännt.
null.verse 26:118: Sentähden tuomitse Sinä minut ja heidät ja pelasta minut sekä minua seuraavat uskovaiset.
null.verse 26:119: Silloin Me pelastimme hänet ja hänen kanssansa olleet keräämällä kaikki arkkiin.
null.verse 26:120: Sitten Me hukutimme muut.
null.verse 26:121: Totisesti, tässä on tunnusmerkki, mutta useimmat heistä eivät ota uskoakseen.
null.verse 26:122: Totisesti, Hän, sinun Herrasi, on kaikkivaltias, kaikkein armollisin.
null.verse 26:123: Myös Aadin heimo piti lähettiläitä valehtelijoina.
null.verse 26:124: Heidän heimolaisensa Huud puhui heille: »Ettekö pelkää Jumalaa?
null.verse 26:125: Totisesti, minä olen luotettava sananjulistaja teille.
null.verse 26:126: Siksi palvelkaa Jumalaa ja totelkaa minua.
null.verse 26:127: En pyydä teiltä siitä mitään palkkaa.
null.verse 26:128: Rakennatteko turhan tähden joka kukkulalle muistomerkin?
null.verse 26:129: Te pystytätte linnoituksia, ikäänkuin ette koskaan kuolisi.
null.verse 26:130: Ja kun te puututte ihmisiin, niin teette sen kuin väkivaltaiset.
null.verse 26:131: Palvelkaa siis Jumalaa ja totelkaa minua.
null.verse 26:132: Palvelkaa Häntä, joka on teille suonut kaiken.
null.verse 26:133: Hän on lahjoittanut teille runsaasti karjaa ja perillisiä,
null.verse 26:135: Todella pelkään tuomion lankeavan päällenne suurena päivänä.
null.verse 26:136: He sanoivat: »Emme välitä siitä, varoitatko meitä vai jätätkö varoittamatta.
null.verse 26:137: Tämä kaikki on vain muinaistaru,
null.verse 26:138: eikä meitä rangaistus odota.
null.verse 26:139: Siten he hylkäsivät hänet, ja siksi Me hävitimme heidät.
null.verse 26:140: Herrasi on Mahtava, Armelias.
null.verse 26:141: Myös Tamuudin heimo piti lähettiläitä valehtelijoina.
null.verse 26:142: Heidän heimolaisensa Saalih puhui heille: »Ettekö pelkää Jumalaa?»
null.verse 26:143: Totisesti, olen teille luotettava sananjulistaja.
null.verse 26:144: Siksi palvelkaa Jumalaa ja totelkaa minua!
null.verse 26:145: En pyydä teiltä siitä mitään palkkaa, sillä minun palkkani on yksin maailmojen Herran huomassa.
null.verse 26:146: Tahdotteko saada turvassa jatkaa nykyistä elämäänne?
null.verse 26:148: viljapelloilla ja hienohedelmäisten palmujen luona,
null.verse 26:149: hakattuanne suurella taidolla asuntonne kallioihin.
null.verse 26:150: Pelätkää siis Jumalaa ja totelkaa minua,
null.verse 26:151: älkääkä noudattako syntisten kutsuja.
null.verse 26:152: He levittävät maassa villitystä eivätkä totuutta rakenna.
null.verse 26:153: He sanoivat: »Sinä kuulut itse lumottuihin.
null.verse 26:154: Olethan vain meidän kaltaisemme ihminen.
null.verse 26:155: Hän vastasi: »Tässä on naaraskameeli, sillä on juottovuoronsa, aivan kuin teillä itsellännekin on määräaikoina vuoronne juoda.
null.verse 26:156: Älkää siis vahingoittako sitä, ettei suuren päivän tuomio lankeaisi päällenne.
null.verse 26:157: Kuitenkin he katkaisivat sen polvijänteet, mutta saivat katua sitä.
null.verse 26:158: Sillä rangaistus saavutti heidät.
null.verse 26:159: Hän, sinun Herrasi, on kaikkivaltias, kaikkein armollisin.
null.verse 26:160: Myöskin Lootin kansa piti lähettiläitä valehtelijoina.
null.verse 26:161: Heidän heimolaisensa Loot puhui heille: »Ettekö pelkää Jumalaa?
null.verse 26:162: Totisesti, olen teille luotettava sananjulistaja.
null.verse 26:163: Sentähden pelätkää Jumalaa ja totelkaa minua!
null.verse 26:164: En pyydä teiltä siitä mitään palkkaa, sillä palkkani on yksin maailmojen valtiaan huomassa.
null.verse 26:165: Kuinka saatattekaan lähestyä kaiken maailman miehiä,
null.verse 26:166: ja hylkiä vaimojanne, jotka Jumala on teille antanut? Ei, te olette irstaisia ihmisiä.
null.verse 26:167: He uhkasivat: »Totisesti, ellet jo herkeä, Loot, niin sinut varmasti karkoitetaan.
null.verse 26:168: Hän lausui: »Totisesti, minä kammoksun teidän tekojanne.
null.verse 26:169: Herra, pelasta minut ja omaiseni heidän hankkeistaan.
null.verse 26:170: Niin Me pelastimme hänet ja hänen perheensä
null.verse 26:171: lukuunottamatta vanhaa naista, joka jäi heistä jälkeen.
null.verse 26:173: Me annoimme sateen langeta heidän päällensä; se oli hirvittävä noille varoituksen saaneille.
null.verse 26:174: Totisesti, tässä on tunnusmerkki, mutta useimmat heistä eivät ota uskoakseen.
null.verse 26:175: Totisesti, Hän, sinun Herrasi, on kaikkivaltias, kaikkein armollisin.
null.verse 26:176: Myös metsien heimo piti lähettiläitä valehtelijoina.
null.verse 26:177: Shuaih puhui heille: »Ettekö pelkää Jumalaa?
null.verse 26:178: Totisesti, olen teille luotettava sananjulistaja.
null.verse 26:179: Pelätkää siis Jumalaa ja totelkaa minua.
null.verse 26:180: En pyydä teiltä siitä mitään palkkaa, palkkani on yksin maailmojen valtiaan huomassa.
null.verse 26:181: Antakaa täysi mitta, ettette kuuluisi vajavasti mittaaviin.
null.verse 26:182: Punnitkaa myös oikealla puntarilla.
null.verse 26:183: Älkää anastako vääryydellä ihmisten varoja älkääkä levittäkö turmelusta maassa väärillä teoillanne.
null.verse 26:184: Pelätkäć Häntä, joka loi teidät ja entisetkin kansat.
null.verse 26:185: He vastasivat: »Sinä olet itse lumouksen vallassa.
null.verse 26:186: Olethan vain meidän kaltaisemme ihminen, ja tiedämme sinun tosiaankin valehtelevan.
null.verse 26:187: Anna vaikka taivaan lohkon pudota päällemme, jos olet tosissasi.
null.verse 26:188: Hän lausui: »Herra tietää, mitä te teette.
null.verse 26:189: Niin he kielsivät hänet, ja tuomiopäivän rangaistus lankesi heidän päällensä.
null.verse 26:190: Totisesti, tässä on merkki, mutta useimmat heistä eivät ota uskoakseen.
null.verse 26:191: Katso, Hän, sinun Herrasi, on kaikkivaltias, kaikkein armollisin.
null.verse 26:192: Totisesti, tämä Koraani on ylhäältä, maailmojen Herralta tullut sanoma.
null.verse 26:193: Sen mukana on tullut uskollinen henki
null.verse 26:194: sydämeesi, jotta olisit yksi niistä, jotka varoittavat
null.verse 26:196: Totisesti, tästä on jo muinaisissa kirjoituksissa.
null.verse 26:197: Eikö siinä ole heille merkki, jotta Israelin kirjanoppineet sen ymmärtäisivät?
null.verse 26:198: Ja jos olisimme ilmaissut sen jollekulle muukalaiselle
null.verse 26:199: ja tämä olisi julistanut sen heille, he eivät olisi sittenkään uskoneet.
null.verse 26:200: Tällä tavoin Me muokkaamme syntisten sydämiä,
null.verse 26:201: vaikka he eivät usko ennenkuin näkevät tuskallisen rangaistuksen.
null.verse 26:202: Se on yllättävä heidät kaikki, kun he eivät aavistakaan.
null.verse 26:203: Silloin he sanovat: »Myönnetäänkö meille ollenkaan armonaikaa?»
null.verse 26:204: Koettavatko he siis jouduttaa Meidän tuomiotamme?
null.verse 26:205: Uskotko, että vaikkapa annamme heidän nauttia jonkun vuoden,
null.verse 26:206: ja heille senjälkeen tulee se, millä heitä on uhattu,
null.verse 26:207: heitä vähääkään hyödyttää se, mistä ovat nauttineet?
null.verse 26:208: Emme ole hävittänyt ainoatakaan kaupunkia lähettämättä sille varoittajia
null.verse 26:209: muistuttamaan.
null.verse 26:210: Eivät pahat henget ole tuoneet sitä (Koraania) maan päälle.
null.verse 26:211: Se ei heitä hyödytä, eivätkä he pysty siihen.
null.verse 26:212: Totisesti, he eivät saata edes kuunnella sitä.
null.verse 26:213: Siksi älä rukoile muita jumalia Jumalan ohella, muuten kuulut niihin, joita kohtaa tuomio.
null.verse 26:214: Varoita myös läheisiä sukulaisiasi.
null.verse 26:215: Ja sulje hyvyyteesi ne uskovaiset, jotka sinua seuraavat.
null.verse 26:216: Jos he eivät sinua tottele, sano silloin: »Totisesti, en vastaa teidän teoistanne.
null.verse 26:217: Luota kaikkivaltiaaseen, kaikkein armollisimpaan.
null.verse 26:218: Häneen, joka näkee sinut, kun nouset rukoilemaan,
null.verse 26:219: ja joka havaitsee askeleesi niiden keskuudessa, jotka kumartavat.
null.verse 26:220: Totisesti, Hän on kaikkikuuleva, kaikkitietävä.
null.verse 26:221: Kerronko teille, kenen päälle pahat henget laskeutuvat?
null.verse 26:222: Ne laskeutuvat jokaisen valheellisen ja syntisen päälle
null.verse 26:223: ja kuiskuttelevat heidän korviinsa, mutta useimmat heistä ovat pettureita,
null.verse 26:224: ja eksyneet seuraavat sellaisia, kuten runoilijoitakin.
null.verse 26:225: Etkö näe heidän harhailevan joka laaksossa, poissa järjiltään.
null.verse 26:226: Ja että he puhuvat sellaista, mitä eivät tee.
null.verse 26:227: Lukuunottamatta niitä heistä, jotka uskovat ja tekevät hyvää ja ahkerasti rukoilevat Jumalaa ja jotka puolustautuvat, kun heitä on sorrettu.

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:2: Voici les versets du Livre évident.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:3: Peut-être te consumes-tu de chagrin parce qu'ils ne sont pas croyants.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:4: Si Nous le voulions, Nous ferions descendre du ciel sur eux un signe devant lequel leurs nuques se courberaient .
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:5: Aucun nouveau rappel ne leur parvient du Miséricordieux sans qu'ils s'en détournent.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:6: Ils ont crié au mensonge, mais bientôt leur parviendront des nouvelles concernant ce dont ils se sont moqués.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:7: Ne jettent-ils pas un regard sur la terre pour voir combien Nous y avons fait pousser d'espèces variées et abondantes ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:8: Il y a vraiment là un signe, mais la plupart des hommes ne sont pas croyants.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:9: Ton Seigneur est, en vérité, l'Omnipotent, le Clément.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:10: Un jour, ton Seigneur appela Moïse et lui dit : " Va trouver le peuple inique,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:12: Il répondit : " Mon Seigneur ! Je crains qu'ils ne me traitent de menteur,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:13: que ma poitrine se resserre et que ma langue ne se délie pas.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:14: Ils ont un crime à me reprocher, et j'ai peur qu'ils ne me tuent ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:15: Dieu dit : " Rien de cela ! Allez tous deux avec Nos signes : Nous serons avec vous, et Nous écouterons.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:16: Rendez-vous donc tous les deux auprès de Pharaon et dites-lui : "Nous sommes les Envoyés du Seigneur des mondes
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:17: afin que tu renvoies avec nous les fils d'Israël" ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:18: Pharaon dit : " Ne t'avons-nous pas élevé chez nous tout enfant et n'as-tu pas passé avec nous plusieurs années de ta vie ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:19: C'est alors que tu as commis l'acte que tu sais, ce qui fait de toi un ingrat ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:20: Moïse dit : " C'est vrai, je l'ai commis, mais j'étais alors du nombre des égarés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:21: Je me suis enfui parce que j'avais peur de vous.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:22: sagesse et Il m'a placé parmi les envoyés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:23: Est-ce là la faveur que tu me reproches, toi qui as réduit en esclavage les fils d'Israël ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:24: Pharaon dit : " Qu'est-ce donc que ce Seigneur des mondes ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 26:25: Moïse dit : " C'est le Seigneur des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui est entre les deux.
